\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
Class that represents an internet (IPv4) address. 

This inherits from the IP-\/specific form of a socket address, {\itshape sockaddr\+\_\+in}.

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{inet\_address()}{inet\_address()}\hspace{0.1cm}{\footnotesize\ttfamily [3/9]}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1inet__address_a9df94b7ac81d5f134ef5b7ed6af8a892} 
sockpp\+::inet\+\_\+address\+::inet\+\_\+address (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{in\+\_\+port\+\_\+t}]{port}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}, {\ttfamily [explicit]}}



Constructs an address for any iface using the specified port. 

This is a convenient way for a server to specify an address that will bind to all interfaces. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em port} & The port number in native/host byte order. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

Constructs an address using the name of the host and the specified port. 

This attempts to resolve the host name to an address.

\Hypertarget{classsockpp_1_1inet__address_accb4141d52b97d95b0512da1a0bf5316}\index{sockpp::inet\_address@{sockpp::inet\_address}!is\_set@{is\_set}}
\index{is\_set@{is\_set}!sockpp::inet\_address@{sockpp::inet\_address}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{is\_set()}{is\_set()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1inet__address_accb4141d52b97d95b0512da1a0bf5316} 
bool sockpp\+::inet\+\_\+address\+::is\+\_\+set (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption}) const\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}, {\ttfamily [override]}, {\ttfamily [virtual]}, {\ttfamily [noexcept]}}



Checks if the address is set to some value. 

This doesn\textquotesingle{}t attempt to determine if the address is valid, simply that it was at least set to an address of this family. \begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
{\itshape true} if the address is set to some value in this family, even if not valid, {\itshape false} if the address is empty. 
\end{DoxyReturn}


Reimplemented from \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1sock__address_ac4e5b06da0efbbc6b8d289e3215f13aa}{sockpp\+::sock\+\_\+address}}.

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{to\_string()}{to\_string()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1inet__address_a7d0ed896d890fcfec8001f2919b94cb5} 
string sockpp\+::inet\+\_\+address\+::to\+\_\+string (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption}) const}



Gets a printable string for the address. 

This gets the simple dot notation of the address as returned from inet\+\_\+ntop(). It does not attempt a host lookup. \begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A string representation of the address in the form \textquotesingle{}address\+:port\textquotesingle{} 
\end{DoxyReturn}
